title: The Tracker's Handbook (gnv64)
description:
The Tracker's Handbook - How to Identify and Trail Any Animal, Anywhere
by Len McDougall
Skyhorse Publishing | January 2015 | ISBN-10: 1629144061  | ePUB | 26.6 mb

Few experiences in the wild are as satisfying as tracking down an animal on its own terms on its own turf. Whether youâ€™re hunting, seeking to capture an animal's image on film or video, or simply trying to get closer to nature, successful tracking is a valuable, and disappearing, skill. The Trackerâ€™s Handbook was written to make anyone, no matter how much experience they have in the wild, better versed in the fine points of tracking North American wildlife. Len McDougallâ€™s book will also cover the modern tools that can make tracking easier.

About the Author
Len McDougall is a professional outdoorsman with four decades of sometimes hard experience in the north woods. He is an internationally recognized survival instructor/tracker. He is the author of The Encyclopedia of Track & Scats, The Log Cabin: An Adventure, Practical Outdoor Survival, and The Snowshoe Almanac. He teaches survival, snowshoeing, kayaking, dogsledding, and tracking classes, and works as a wilderness guide. He currently lives in Paradise, Michigan.

- Family Cervidae
- Family Suidae

- Family Felidae
- Family Ursidae
- Family Procyonidae
- Family Sciuridae
- Family Erethizontidae
- Family Leporidae
Birds

- Shore and Water Birds
- Predatory Birds
Reptiles and Amphibians
- Snakes  
- Turtles
